channel.title: Everything I download says it is corrupt
channel.description:
I just reformatted my desktop pc after it started crashing a lot, as I usually do every few months.
Now I've re installed windows I've began downloading drivers, however everything I download at some point stops in its installation and says "Cannot continue: COrrupt".
So what do I do?

item.title: Everything I download says it is corrupt
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:7, topic:244980”][quote author=davidude36 link=topic=321393.msg2544617#msg2544617 date=1227210050]
Okay just reformatted again and everything is working normal now.

I guess something was corrupted while windows was being installed and this caused stuff to fuck up during installations. Gay.
[/quote]Do not format your HDD too much. Every re-format shortens it’s life.[/quote]

Not really, HDD != flash.

Read full topic

Your network interface might be fucked, only getting partial files.

item.title: Everything I download says it is corrupt
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.source: Everything I download says it is corrupt

item.title: Everything I download says it is corrupt
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

I doubt its microsoft, and I doubt its the hard drive even more. I’m almost certain its a motherboard/memory problem. I’ve had this problem since I got this computer which was 3 years ago and I’ve changed the memory once or twice.

I could do with getting a brand new computer, but alas I have more important things to waste my money on. I’ve almost finished installing windows again, hopefully will work fine this time.

Read full topic
item.source: Everything I download says it is corrupt

item.title: Everything I download says it is corrupt
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Yeah pretty sure it’s memory problems, but reformatting usually fixes it for a month or two. Guess I’ll reformat again

Read full topic
